alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Armstrong; Beaver; Butler; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 11:23PM EDT until July 21 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR ALLEGHENY, NORTHERN WASHINGTON, NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND, SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG, SOUTHERN BUTLER, WESTERN INDIANA AND SOUTHERN BEAVER COUNTIES... At 1123 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, McMurray, McKeesport, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Canonsburg, Monaca, Vandergrift, Apollo, Avella, Gastonville and Shaler Township. Numerous roads were reported flooded across the area. Five vehicles were reported near the Duquesne Mckeesport bridge caught in rising flood water, with swift water rescue teams activated. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Allegheny; Armstrong; Beaver; Butler; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland
